cpu("BoltX"). watt("BoltX", 85). cost("BoltX", 400).
cpu("HydraPro"). watt("HydraPro", 125). cost("HydraPro", 550).
cpu("LiteCore"). watt("LiteCore", 60). cost("LiteCore", 350).

generator:
1 { selected_cpu(C) : cpu(C) } 1.
1 { selected_gpu(G) : gpu(G) } 1.
1 { selected_psu(P) : psu(P) } 1.
selected(X) :- selected_cpu(X).
selected(X) :- selected_gpu(X).
selected(X) :- selected_psu(X).

hard_constraints.description: To prevent overloading under peak load, the combined wattage of the selected CPU and GPU must be at least 100W lower than the total capacity of the selected power supply.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- selected_cpu(C), selected_gpu(G), selected_psu(P), watt(C, WC), watt(G, WG), capacity(P, CP), WC + WG > CP - 100.

hard_constraints.description: In our build philosophy, cost must follow performance; therefore, any component that is the most power-hungry in terms of wattage must also be the most expensive component in the setup.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- selected(X), watt(X, W), MW = #max { W1 : selected(Y), watt(Y, W1) }, W == MW, cost(X, CX), MC = #max { C1 : selected(Y), cost(Y, C1) }, CX < MC.

hard_constraints.description: Please ensure that the HydraPro CPU and the VegaLite GPU are never selected together, as they are incompatible due to thermal constraints.
To maintain system stability, the Eco600 power supply cannot be used in conjunction with the StormZ GPU because of voltage regulation requirements.
Class, we must maintain a certain level of performance quality; you are strictly prohibited from selecting the cheapest component in all three categories simultaneously.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- selected_cpu(C), cost(C, CX), MINC = #min { V : cpu(I), cost(I, V) }, CX == MINC, selected_gpu(G), cost(G, GX), MING = #min { V : gpu(I), cost(I, V) }, GX == MING, selected_psu(P), cost(P, PX), MINP = #min { V : psu(I), cost(I, V) }, PX == MINP.

hard_constraints.description: To ensure the build is balanced, no two selected components can have a price difference that exceeds $400.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- selected(X), selected(Y), cost(X, CX), cost(Y, CY), CX - CY > 400.
